newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK activists protest China's jailing of dissidents.
newsitem.headline: HK activists protest China's jailing of dissidents.

text.p: Pro-democracy activists staged a protest outside China's mission in Hong Kong on Friday to demand an end to the persecution of dissidents and the release of critics imprisoned by Beijing's communist authorities.

A dozen representatives of a Hong Kong alliance campaigning for democracy in China waved banners and pictures of jailed dissidents outside the Xinhua news agency building, China's de facto embassy in the British colony.
The group, led by the deputy chairman of Hong Kong's Democratic Party, Szeto Wah, demanded the immediate release of dissidents Liu Xiaobo, Wang Dan, Wang Xizhe and Guo Haifeng.

"The Alliance strongly censures such actions by the authorities and urges them to free the dissidents immediately ...and not to convict them on the basis of speech or thought, to restore the rule of the people and build a democratic China," the group said in a protest statement.
China, which resumes control of Hong Kong from Britain next year, brands the Hong Kong alliance as subversive because it advocates democracy in China.
